page.title: 11ECOLOGY AND LAND OWNERSHIP
page.content: The area enjoys a mild climate sheltered from the north by{Bredon {hill}and from the prevailing south-westerly winds by{Oxenton hill.} To avoid the frost hollow farmers use the lower slopes of the hill for soft fruit. Farming changes have drastically altered the appearance of the landscape.In 1940 there were 15 independent small farms in between the Overbury estates to the north and other privately owned estates to the south.Today there are nine and three of these are owned by banks and syndicates.
